strategist.sanitized: Scenario ‚Äî Shareable reward ‚Äî Transitioning to double passes is a clear win. It doubles the perceived value and aligns with the family-centric theme of the promotion. The prize budget remains the same, but the winner count drops to 1005, ensuring each win feels more substantial. This shift keeps the spirit of the promotion intact, focusing on shared experiences without compromising fairness. Scenario ‚Äî Cadence burst ‚Äî Implementing a daily winner burst keeps the excitement alive and encourages repeat purchases. With 17.5 winners per day, the promotion maintains a steady drumbeat of engagement, making each day feel like a fresh opportunity. Operationally, this requires no additional resources, as the existing digital infrastructure handles the cadence. Monitoring daily entry spikes will guide adjustments to maintain consumer interest. Scenario ‚Äî Hero overlay ‚Äî Introduce a hero tier with a grand prize of a $10K home cinema makeover, funded by reallocating 5% of the existing prize budget. This prize amplifies the movie night experience, positioning Wicked Sister as a brand that elevates home entertainment. Retailers can weave this narrative into their digital channels, enhancing brand storytelling without adding in-store pressure. Fairness is preserved by maintaining transparency in prize distribution. Measurement ‚Äî Track the redemption rate of double passes against initial single ticket uptake. Summary - Transition to double passes to enhance shared experiences, reducing winners to 1005 without extra cost. - Implement a daily winner burst to sustain engagement, leveraging existing infrastructure. - Introduce a $10K home cinema makeover hero tier, reallocating 5% of the prize budget for enhanced storytelling.

ideas.what: Customers can name a custom sundae inspired by the upcoming Wicked film, and receive personalized digital artwork of their creation.
ideas.why: Naming rights foster ownership and personalization, increasing emotional attachment to the brand's products during the movie tie-in.
ideas.retailRun: Digital platforms encourage entries by prompting consumers to buy two products, upload receipts, and create a unique sundae.
ideas.xForY: ‚ÄòName a Coke‚Äô mass personalization from Beverage applied to Frozen Desserts because creating personal narratives enhances consumer engagement.

ideas.hook: Every Hour Movie Draw with Cashback
ideas.what: For every two-pack purchase uploaded, buyers receive an entry into an hourly movie ticket draw plus cashback as store credit.
ideas.why: Replicating casino-style jackpot timing builds anticipation, while cashback encourages future purchases, forming a compelling reward loop.
ideas.retailRun: Synched with grocery apps to offer immediate feedback on draws and credits for grocery chains like Coles or Woolworths.
ideas.xForY: 'Winner-an-hour' cadence illusion from Casinos applied to Grocery Retail because constant anticipation hooks daily shopping patterns.

ideas.what: 'Casting Ticket': Winners voice-record themselves reading lines; final selections receive animated avatar cameos in advertising spots leading to film release.
ideas.why: "Sir Guinness" gives everyday consumers an evocative experience by having them 'own' part of the launch narrative‚Äîintensifying engagement.
ideas.retailRun: "Casting Boxes" sold exclusively through retailers bundle dessert with a unique QR code for content submission upon receipt proofing.
ideas.xForY: 'Symbolic co-ownership' live narrative immersion from Entertainment applied to Frozen Desserts because fans crave deeper bonds beyond product consumption.

ideas.what: Buy two Wicked Sister desserts, upload your receipt, and uncover an instant chance to score a movie ticket.
ideas.why: Integrating instant win with dessert purchases triggers excitement. This drives purchase frequency while adding anticipation to routine grocery runs.
ideas.retailRun: Engage customers in physical grocery stores (Coles, Woolworths) and incentivize through digital apps and platforms.
ideas.xForY: [Instant win] from [Lotteries] applied to [Grocery] because [grocery shopping often feels routine].

ideas.what: Collectible cartons featuring characters from ‚ÄòWicked‚Äô film could unlock different levels of premium movie rewards‚Äîpremieres, behind-the-scenes content.
ideas.why: This cross-promotion boosts brand affinity by aligning desserts with the beloved franchise, encouraging collection due to visual appeal and added value.
ideas.retailRun: Available exclusively online and in-store during weekends creating peak buying moments.
ideas.xForY: [Franchise collectibles] from [Comic Books] applied to [Frozen Desserts] because [visuals engage families around shared fandom].

ideas.what: "Co-own" a piece of select cinema showings with every eligible purchase leading up to the film launch. Customers get their names featured as symbolic 'owners' in movie credits or on popcorn tubs at select screenings.
ideas.why: 'Sweetshares' blurs lines between product engagement and entertainment, fostering deep consumer-brand connection by making them insiders in a tangible way.
ideas.retailRun: "Experience spheres" in theatres; codes available exclusively via major retail receipts online for verified purchases only.
ideas.xForY: [Co-ownership sliver] from [Fine Arts and Theatre Patrons] applied to [Retail Gifting experience] because [showing up as part of a community fuels identity].
ideas.legalVariant: 'Be Featured Fan List' where fan name inclusion is more distant but honourable acknowledgment than actual credit.

ideas.what: Customers collect unique codes inside each purchased product to play a bingo-style game. Completing lines or patterns unlocks immediate movie ticket rewards.
ideas.why: Bingo combines familiar excitement with thrill of instant win, increasing multi-pack purchases and engagement in a fun manner.
ideas.retailRun: Codes are printed in packaged desserts, linking online through brand's app for immediate validation and reward redemption.
ideas.xForY: Bingo from board games applied to frozen desserts because it taps into social gaming while encouraging multi-buy habits.

ideas.what: Launches mystery-tier packaging that can be 'opened' online. Each tier reveals exciting rewards like exclusive movie screenings or meet-the-cast opportunities.
ideas.why: "Ticketisation" builds suspense, each purchase feels like unwrapping a present enhancing purchase frequency.
ideas.retailRun: Includes special packs with concealed peel-away components leading customers online to discover their ‚Äòticket‚Äô tier instantly.
ideas.xForY: [Mystery Tier Box] from Subscription Boxes applied to [Frozen Desserts] because [it activates collector mentality & surprise].

ideas.what: 'Flavor Avatars' are created for each customer using personalized digital animations tied to their purchase history. They evolve into virtual characters with narrative roles in movie trailer-like clips integrating live updates.
ideas.why: "Cross-Category Steal" converts typical personalisation into gamified storytelling making repeated purchases meaningful by weaving dessert experiences into cinematic narratives.
ideas.retailRun: 'Flavor Avatars' gain new backstory elements tied to specific desserts bought‚Äîpurchasing more adds layers to their ongoing digital saga shown through engaging mini-movies before film trailers online.
ideas.xForY: [Virtual Avatar Mechanics] from Online Gaming applied to [Frozen Desserts] because [it constructs interactive personal stories].
operatorCards: Cross-category steal (lift mechanic from another industry)
ideas.legalVariant: 'Simplified Flavor Characters': Users earn static character cards per product, no story evolution or animation‚Äîjust collectible flair.

ideas.what: Transform ordinary dessert lids into collectible items featuring iconic scenes from the 'Wicked' movie, encouraging repeat purchases to complete the set.
ideas.why: This leverages collection pressure to increase product purchase frequency, turning each buy into part of a larger goal, while tapping into fans' desire to own exclusive film memorabilia.
ideas.retailRun: Release different lid designs across stores every two weeks; customers can swap extras using a dedicated app community.
ideas.xForY: Collection sets from Trading Cards applied to Frozen Desserts because fans love completion and exclusivity.

ideas.what: Insert limited golden scoops in products where finding one not only wins a movie ticket but also bestows co-ownership naming rights to special showtimes or characters in promotional materials.
ideas.why: Borrowing from the instant win concept and chocolate bar 'Golden Ticket', this adds exciting layers by blending tangible discovery with name recognition rewards.
ideas.retailRun: 'Golden scoops' announced on store and digital channels; winners sign special showtime entry books for their named credit.
ideas.xForY: 'Golden Ticket' from Confectionery applied to Frozen Desserts because discovering surprises makes family treat time exciting.

ideas.what: 'Dessert Payback' lets customers enjoy two-for-one desserts‚Äîget half your spend refunded after submitting box tops online when you watch any subsequent purchase movies with friends post-campaign.
ideas.why: 'Get paid to try' radically shifts perception; it positions Wicked Sister as investing in lasting relationships by refunding group entertainment linked back to them.
ideas.retailRun: `Selfie-d' out-of-theatre friends claims verified via app for social impact; encourage fans to pile in through engagement flow online and media influence battles via TikTok/Instagram story reposts showcasing desserts as feature night anchors after celebratory nights in theatres globally campaign.
ideas.xForY: Cashback promo from Banking Industry applied to Food & Beverage because incentivizing future consumption deepens brand loyalty innovation .
ideas.legalVariant: Make it simpler: consumers redeem a straight discount on future purchases instead of complex refunds.

ideas.hook: Collect all Frozen Dessert Movie Tickets
ideas.what: After uploading their receipt, participants not only win movie tickets but also unlock a collectible series of virtual 'Frozen Dessert Movie Tickets' featuring themes and characters from the upcoming film.
ideas.why: Adds layers to the existing instant-win mechanic by encouraging collection pressure, building anticipation for the film while cementing brand loyalty.
ideas.retailRun: Roll out custom-themed tickets across grocery and convenience stores with each series release tied to specific participating retailers.
ideas.xForY: [Collection Pressure] from [Trading Card Games] applied to [Frozen Desserts] because [collectibles drive repeat purchases].

ideas.what: Introduce a personalisation layer where consumers name one of Wicked Sister's new limited-edition desserts during the campaign‚Äîlike naming a star in the galaxy but in the frozen aisle.
ideas.why: Draws on unique personalization experiences to increase product interaction, making customers feel directly connected to the brand‚Äôs new offerings.
ideas.retailRun: Encourage in-store engagement with displays that highlight customer-named desserts at major retailers.
ideas.xForY: [Personalise at scale] from [Souvenirs & Memorabilia Naming Rights] applied to [Frozen Desserts] because [names drive affinity and sharing].

ideas.what: $7 upfront cost for two Wicked Sisters products with a potential chance to earn $10 back if selected as an 'instant winner' post-receipt upload‚Äîpushing boundaries of traditional price mechanics.
ideas.why: Flips conventional pricing models, enticing consumers with financial rebating coupled with thrill-seeking excitement, driving dual motivations: purchase incentive plus potential profit.
ideas.retailRun: $7 bags available at select retailers; prominent signage emphasizes this gamble mechanic in high foot traffic aisles.
ideas.xForY: [Cashback / Negative Price] from [Financial Rebates] applied to [Frozen Desserts] because [people love low-risk-high-reward propositions].

harness.point: The 'Golden Scoop' Ticket Hunt concept combines the thrill of discovery with the allure of exclusive rewards. By inserting limited golden scoops in products, customers are enticed to purchase more for a chance to win movie tickets and gain co-ownership naming rights to special showtimes or characters in promotional materials. This creates a buzz and drives repeat purchases, while the naming rights add a personal touch, enhancing brand loyalty.
harness.move: Launch the 'Golden Scoop' campaign across major retail chains and digital platforms. Promote through social media and in-store displays, highlighting the excitement of finding a golden scoop and the unique rewards it offers. Encourage customers to share their finds online to amplify reach and engagement.
harness.risk: The primary risk is ensuring a fair distribution of golden scoops to avoid customer dissatisfaction. Additionally, the naming rights must be clearly defined to prevent any legal complications or misunderstandings about the extent of the ownership.
harness.oddsCadence: 1 in 100 chance for golden scoop; winners announced weekly.
harness.retailerLine: Till: 'Find a golden scoop for movie magic!' POS: 'Discover your scoop and name a showtime!'

extras.title: hooks
extras.content:
1. **Taste the Magic, Win the Night!** ‚Äî This line directly connects the indulgence of dessert with the thrill of a movie experience, creating excitement around both elements.

2. **Dessert Dreams Meet Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Evokes a sense of fantasy while emphasizing the chance to win, appealing to consumers‚Äô desires for both treats and experiences.

3. **Unlock a Night at the Movies!** ‚Äî Leverages the idea of discovery and opportunity, inviting consumers to participate in a rewarding experience.

4. **Indulge and Instantly Win Wicked Surprises!** ‚Äî The use of 'instantly' enhances the promotional urgency while aligning with the indulgent nature of the product.

5. **Sweet Treats, Sweet Wins: Join the Wicked Fun!** ‚Äî This tagline positions the promotion as part of a collective experience, encouraging shared participation.

6. **Win the Ultimate Movie Night Experience!** ‚Äî Highlights a desirable outcome that resonates with family-oriented consumers looking to enhance their home entertainment.

7. **Dive into Delicious Desserts and Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Conveys the excitement of indulgence while emphasizing the potential for winning, creating a sense of adventure.

8. **Scoop Up Sweet Rewards with Wicked Sisters!** ‚Äî Invokes a playful tone while reinforcing the brand identity, cementing the connection between dessert and winning.

9. **Your Ticket to a Magical Movie Night Awaits!** ‚Äî Suggests that participation is not just about dessert, but about creating memorable experiences, enhancing perceived value.

10. **Grab a Spoon, Grab a Chance at Wicked Prizes!** ‚Äî Combines the act of indulging in desserts with the excitement of winning, making it effortless and engaging.

11. **Indulgence Meets Instant Gratification: Join the Wicked Experience!** ‚Äî This tagline captures the essence of the campaign, appealing to modern consumers' craving for both luxury and immediacy.

12. **Feel the Magic ‚Äî Win Big with Wicked Sisters!** ‚Äî Ties the emotional resonance of the film experience to the promotion, creating an engaging narrative for consumers.

13. **Delight in Every Scoop, Win Every Time!** ‚Äî Reinforces the idea of enjoyment with the added incentive of winning, promoting an ongoing relationship with the product.

14. **Join the Dessert Revolution: Win Wickedly Instant Prizes!** ‚Äî Positions the promotion as trendy and exciting, appealing to consumers looking for new experiences.

15. **Experience the Enchantment: Win Wicked Movie Magic!** ‚Äî Playfully connects the campaign to the film's themes, creating a sense of anticipation and excitement.

16. **Unwrap the Magic of Wicked Prizes with Every Bite!** ‚Äî Suggests that each dessert brings the possibility of winning, reinforcing the idea of enchantment.

17. **Your Dessert Just Became a Treasure Hunt for Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Adds an element of adventure and surprise to the act of indulging in desserts, enticing engagement.

18. **Taste the Adventure, Win the Night with Wicked Sisters!** ‚Äî Enhances the campaign's call to action by framing it in terms of exploration and excitement.

19. **Sweeten Your Movie Nights with Instant Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Directly appeals to family-centered moments, making desserts a part of treasured experiences.

20. **Dare to Dream: Indulge in Desserts and Win Wickedly!** ‚Äî Encourages consumers to embrace their desires while promising tangible rewards, fostering a sense of aspiration.

simplicity.fix: Keep claim one-screen; limit fields; good OCR; publish timelines.

certainty.fix: Show cadence and ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù; avoid fine print that hides odds.

salience.why: Needs a visible moment or total-winners headline.
salience.fix: Publish ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù and name the cadence; add a bold moment line.

talkability.fix: Add a brand-right experiential or symbolic angle.

retailerFit.why: Ensure any adjudication is central; ship pre-packed POS.
retailerFit.fix: Keep staff script ‚â§5s; no in-store adjudication.

brandFit.fix: Lock line and visuals to distinctive assets and the brand‚Äôs functional truth.

recommendations: Add: expected buyers/entries and total winners, or show ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù and cadence in communications.
Keep claim one-screen; limit fields; good OCR; publish timelines.
Publish ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù and name the cadence; add a bold moment line.
Publish ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù and show cadence prominently.
Add visible cadence (instant or weekly) to match in-market fairness signals.

brandTruths.text: Wicked Sister is leveraging the excitement of the upcoming 'Wicked: For Good' film by launching a limited-edition dessert pot range, aiming to drive consumer engagement through a movie-themed promotion.

The brand's promotion offers an instant win mechanic, where purchasing two packs of Wicked Sister products gives consumers a chance to win movie tickets, effectively incentivizing multi-pack purchases.

shopperTensions.text: Consumers are increasingly seeking convenience and indulgence, yet face cost-of-living pressures that may limit discretionary spending on premium desserts.
While Wicked Sister positions itself as an everyday indulgence, the need to balance health-conscious choices with indulgence may create tension for health-aware consumers.

retailerReality.text: Coles and Woolworths dominate the retail landscape, with exclusive promotions like the Wicked Sister x Wicked campaign running through Woolworths, highlighting the retailer's clout in driving brand visibility.
Freezer congestion in major supermarkets can limit shelf space for new product launches, making strategic partnerships with retailers crucial for visibility.

competitorMoves.text: Rokeby Farms is expanding its product range with high-protein offerings, appealing to health-conscious consumers and potentially diverting attention from indulgent dessert options.
Competitors like Streets continue to maintain strong market presence, emphasizing the need for Wicked Sister to differentiate through unique promotions and partnerships.

categorySignals.text: The frozen desserts market is projected to grow significantly, with a CAGR of approximately 5.4% from 2024 to 2034, indicating a robust opportunity for brands like Wicked Sister to capture market share.

The Australian ice cream market is expected to grow at a slower pace, with a 1.51% CAGR, suggesting that innovation and unique marketing strategies will be key to driving growth in the frozen dessert segment.

framingMeta.behavioural_objective: Drive two-pack purchases and capture opted-in dessert fans before the Wicked film release.

mindsets.name: Family Builders
mindsets.job: Reward the family with purposeful treats that feel magical but still practical.

improvement_hypotheses: If reward is single-admit (e.g., one ticket), test pairing (two passes) to enable shared experience without inflating perceived cost.
Default to a double pass so no one goes alone; optionally test Family or Gold Class tiers.
Test a tight hero overlay (3 winners) aligned to the IP theme; keep breadth and cadence visible.
Add a symbolic prize to enhance brand connection
Highlight total winners to improve perceived odds

adequacy.why: Expected buyers/entries not provided; adequacy judged via cadence and visibility.
adequacy.fix: Add: expected buyers/entries and total winners, or show ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù and cadence in communications.

simplicity.why: Some admin implied (fields/proof or wait time).
simplicity.fix: Keep claim one-screen; limit fields; good OCR; publish timelines.

certainty.fix: Show cadence and ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù; avoid fine print that hides odds.

salience.why: Needs a visible moment or total-winners headline.
salience.fix: Publish ‚ÄúTotal winners‚Äù and name the cadence; add a bold moment line.

talkability.fix: Add a brand-right experiential or symbolic angle.

retailerFit.why: Ensure any adjudication is central; ship pre-packed POS.
retailerFit.fix: Keep staff script ‚â§5s; no in-store adjudication.

brandFit.fix: Lock line and visuals to distinctive assets and the brand‚Äôs functional truth.

brandTruths.text: Wicked Sister is leveraging the excitement of the upcoming 'Wicked: For Good' film by launching a limited-edition dessert pot range, aiming to drive consumer engagement through a movie-themed promotion.

The brand's promotion offers an instant win mechanic, where purchasing two packs of Wicked Sister products gives consumers a chance to win movie tickets, effectively incentivizing multi-pack purchases.

shopperTensions.text: Consumers are increasingly seeking convenience and indulgence, yet face cost-of-living pressures that may limit discretionary spending on premium desserts.
While Wicked Sister positions itself as an everyday indulgence, the need to balance health-conscious choices with indulgence may create tension for health-aware consumers.

retailerReality.text: Coles and Woolworths dominate the retail landscape, with exclusive promotions like the Wicked Sister x Wicked campaign running through Woolworths, highlighting the retailer's clout in driving brand visibility.
Freezer congestion in major supermarkets can limit shelf space for new product launches, making strategic partnerships with retailers crucial for visibility.

competitorMoves.text: Rokeby Farms is expanding its product range with high-protein offerings, appealing to health-conscious consumers and potentially diverting attention from indulgent dessert options.
Competitors like Streets continue to maintain strong market presence, emphasizing the need for Wicked Sister to differentiate through unique promotions and partnerships.

categorySignals.text: The frozen desserts market is projected to grow significantly, with a CAGR of approximately 5.4% from 2024 to 2034, indicating a robust opportunity for brands like Wicked Sister to capture market share.

The Australian ice cream market is expected to grow at a slower pace, with a 1.51% CAGR, suggesting that innovation and unique marketing strategies will be key to driving growth in the frozen dessert segment.

judgeInputs.framing:
Where the Demand Is

Spring in Australia is a time of renewal and fresh starts. Consumers are drawn to lighter, indulgent treats as the weather warms up. The frozen dessert market is expanding, with a projected growth rate of 5.4% from 2024 to 2034 (Source: globalinsightservices.com). This growth is driven by a desire for convenient yet premium dessert options. As grocery shopping trends shift towards convenience and indulgence, Wicked Sister is well-positioned to capture attention with its movie-themed promotion.

Who It‚Äôs For & What Stops Them

The primary audience includes grocery buyers who enjoy treating their families to indulgent desserts. They plan movie nights and share their dessert finds on social media. However, cost-of-living pressures can limit their spending on premium items (Source: retail.org.au). Health-conscious consumers might also hesitate, balancing indulgence with health considerations. These buyers seek value and convenience, making instant win promotions appealing.

Competitor Map

Streets and Sara Lee are key competitors in the frozen dessert category. Streets maintains a strong presence with classic offerings, while Sara Lee focuses on indulgent, ready-to-serve desserts. Rokeby Farms, with its high-protein products, appeals to health-conscious consumers, potentially diverting attention from more indulgent options (Source: rokebynutrition.com). Wicked Sister's unique movie tie-in and instant win mechanic differentiate it by offering an experiential reward.

Brand Lens (truth, codes to lean/break)

Wicked Sister embodies everyday indulgence, aligning with family movie nights through its movie-themed promotions. The brand breaks away from complex entry mechanics and single mega-prizes, focusing instead on instant wins and family rewards. Wicked Sister‚Äôs playful and exciting tone of voice emphasizes the thrill of winning, while its distinctive assets include movie-themed packaging and indulgent dessert messaging.

The Idea As It Stands

The current promotion invites consumers to buy two packs of Wicked Sister products for a chance to instantly win a movie ticket. This mechanic encourages multi-pack purchases, driving sales and engagement ahead of the Wicked film release. The instant win format is straightforward, appealing to consumers seeking immediate gratification.

Proposition Candidates

1. Indulge in a Wicked Treat
2. Win Your Movie Night
3. Instant Movie Magic

Hooks (2‚Äì6 words)

Win a Movie Ticket Instantly  
Indulge and Win  
Movie Night Magic  

What We‚Äôd Lean On

The instant win mechanic is the promotion's backbone, providing immediate excitement and gratification. The tie-in with the Wicked film adds a layer of thematic engagement, appealing to families planning movie nights. The broad distribution across major retailers like Coles and Woolworths ensures visibility and accessibility.

Hypotheses for Evaluation

1. The instant win mechanic will drive higher purchase volume due to its immediate reward.
2. The movie tie-in will enhance brand engagement, particularly among families planning movie nights.
3. The promotion will increase brand visibility and shelf presence in major retailers.

Entry/Redemption (from brief): Buy 2 qualifying products, upload receipt

judgeInputs.evaluation:
Verdict ‚Äî This promotion remains a NO-GO as it currently fails to bridge consumer cost sensitivity with perceived indulgence value, overshadowing the instant win excitement with inadequate prize breadth. Why it works ‚Äî Wicked Sister leverages the cultural moment of 'Wicked: For Good' to align with family movie nights, capturing the emotional high of communal experiences (Source: insidefmcg.com.au). This speaks to the consumer‚Äôs desire for convenient yet indulgent treats, tapping into the seasonal surge for lighter dessert options (Source: retail.org.au). Where it breaks ‚Äî The current mechanic struggles with the balance between indulgence and perceived health value, alienating health-aware consumers (Source: wickedsister.com.au). Additionally, the single ticket prize fails to deliver the high perceived value expected from a family-centric promotion. Fix it ‚Äî Transition to double passes, ensuring the perceived value aligns with shared family experiences; acknowledge the halving of winner count to approximately 1005 for clarity and transparency. Retailer reality ‚Äî The promotion dovetails with high-traffic retailers like Coles and Woolworths, maintaining brand visibility without burdening store teams, and leverages pre-existing promotional channels (Source: woolworths.com.au). Tighten ‚Äî Communicate the double pass upgrade across all consumer-facing channels, reinforcing the enhanced value. Stretch ‚Äî Integrate movie-themed digital engagement, like cinema trivia, to deepen the experiential hook without store-level strain. Hook upgrade ‚Äî ‚ÄúDouble the Movie Magic‚Äù fails to highlight the experiential richness of the prize; the angle should emphasize shared experiences and immediate delight. Hook shortlist ‚Äî - ‚ÄúTwo Desserts. Two Tickets.‚Äù - ‚ÄúMovie Night for Two.‚Äù - ‚ÄúCinema Nights, Doubled Delight.‚Äù - ‚ÄúShare the Movie Magic.‚Äù - ‚ÄúTwice the Fun, Double the Seats.‚Äù Measurement ‚Äî Track redemption rate of double passes against initial single ticket uptake. Pack line ‚Äî ‚ÄúDouble Your Movie Magic‚Äù Staff line ‚Äî ‚ÄúEnjoy two movie tickets with your desserts.‚Äù

Key campaign-specific directives:
‚Ä¢ shopper tension: Consumers are increasingly seeking convenience and indulgence, yet face cost-of-living pressures that may limit discretionary spending on premium desserts. (retail.org.au)
‚Ä¢ shopper tension: While Wicked Sister positions itself as an everyday indulgence, the need to balance health-conscious choices with indulgence may create tension for health-aware consumers. (wickedsister.com.au)
‚Ä¢ brand truth: Wicked Sister is leveraging the excitement of the upcoming 'Wicked: For Good' film by launching a limited-edition dessert pot range, aiming to drive consumer engagement through a movie-themed promotion. (insidefmcg.com.au)
judgeInputs.opinion:
Wicked Sister stands poised at the confluence of indulgence and experience, ready to ignite the market with its Spring Movie Launch. This moment matters because it aligns with the cultural moment of 'Wicked: For Good,' inviting families to indulge in shared cinematic adventures. As the frozen dessert market blossoms with a 5.4% growth rate, Wicked Sister‚Äôs promotion captures the moment of renewal and shared delight, offering a unique proposition that disrupts the everyday indulgence category. Today, the brand truth marries shopper tension and retailer reality with cultural timing. Consumers crave indulgence yet face cost-of-living strains; a double movie pass speaks to this tension, offering value that resonates with family-centric buyers. Retailers like Coles and Woolworths provide the perfect stage for this promotion, ensuring broad accessibility and visibility. The instant win mechanic dovetails with the seasonal demand for lighter, indulgent treats, making it an irresistible offer (Source: retail.org.au). Improving this plan involves transforming single movie tickets into double passes, ensuring perceived value meets family expectations. Strategist insights show that halving the winner count to 1005 enhances shared experiences, aligning with our KPI of driving two-pack purchases. A daily winner burst cadence will maintain engagement, creating urgency and excitement. The communication strategy will reinforce the upgrade, leveraging existing channels to ensure clarity and buzz (Source: insidefmcg.com.au). For retailers, the promotion fits seamlessly into existing frameworks, reqring no additional staff lift or in-store adjudication. Display asks remain minimal, relying on pre-packed POS materials that maintain brand visibility without encroaching on freezer space. This operational simplicity ensures that the campaign enhances foot traffic without added complexity (Source: woolworths.com.au). To tighten, we will communicate the double pass upgrade across all consumer touchpoints, enhancing perceived value and driving participation. This pragmatic tweak ensures clarity and alignment with family-centric expectations. To stretch, we will introduce movie-themed digital engagement, such as cinema trivia, adding depth to the experiential hook and enriching consumer interaction. This bolder extension keeps the in-store reality grounded while elevating the campaign‚Äôs appeal. ‚ÄúDouble Your Movie Magic‚Äù ‚ÄúEnjoy two movie tickets with your desserts.‚Äù

To improve it, publish the fact there are 2,010 winners so the breadth feels real. retune the hook to ‚ÄúDouble the Movie Magic‚Äù so it sounds like Wicked Sister, not a generic instant win.
judgeInputs.strategist: Scenario ‚Äî Shareable reward ‚Äî Transitioning to double passes is a clear win. It doubles the perceived value and aligns with the family-centric theme of the promotion. The prize budget remains the same, but the winner count drops to 1005, ensuring each win feels more substantial. This shift keeps the spirit of the promotion intact, focusing on shared experiences without compromising fairness. Scenario ‚Äî Cadence burst ‚Äî Implementing a daily winner burst keeps the excitement alive and encourages repeat purchases. With 17.5 winners per day, the promotion maintains a steady drumbeat of engagement, making each day feel like a fresh opportunity. Operationally, this requires no additional resources, as the existing digital infrastructure handles the cadence. Monitoring daily entry spikes will guide adjustments to maintain consumer interest. Scenario ‚Äî Hero overlay ‚Äî Introduce a hero tier with a grand prize of a $10K home cinema makeover, funded by reallocating 5% of the existing prize budget. This prize amplifies the movie night experience, positioning Wicked Sister as a brand that elevates home entertainment. Retailers can weave this narrative into their digital channels, enhancing brand storytelling without adding in-store pressure. Fairness is preserved by maintaining transparency in prize distribution. Measurement ‚Äî Track the redemption rate of double passes against initial single ticket uptake. Summary - Transition to double passes to enhance shared experiences, reducing winners to 1005 without extra cost. - Implement a daily winner burst to sustain engagement, leveraging existing infrastructure. - Introduce a $10K home cinema makeover hero tier, reallocating 5% of the prize budget for enhanced storytelling.

brandTruths.text: Wicked Sister is leveraging the excitement of the upcoming 'Wicked: For Good' film by launching a limited-edition dessert pot range, aiming to drive consumer engagement through a movie-themed promotion.

The brand's promotion offers an instant win mechanic, where purchasing two packs of Wicked Sister products gives consumers a chance to win movie tickets, effectively incentivizing multi-pack purchases.

shopperTensions.text: Consumers are increasingly seeking convenience and indulgence, yet face cost-of-living pressures that may limit discretionary spending on premium desserts.
While Wicked Sister positions itself as an everyday indulgence, the need to balance health-conscious choices with indulgence may create tension for health-aware consumers.

retailerReality.text: Coles and Woolworths dominate the retail landscape, with exclusive promotions like the Wicked Sister x Wicked campaign running through Woolworths, highlighting the retailer's clout in driving brand visibility.
Freezer congestion in major supermarkets can limit shelf space for new product launches, making strategic partnerships with retailers crucial for visibility.

competitorMoves.text: Rokeby Farms is expanding its product range with high-protein offerings, appealing to health-conscious consumers and potentially diverting attention from indulgent dessert options.
Competitors like Streets continue to maintain strong market presence, emphasizing the need for Wicked Sister to differentiate through unique promotions and partnerships.

categorySignals.text: The frozen desserts market is projected to grow significantly, with a CAGR of approximately 5.4% from 2024 to 2034, indicating a robust opportunity for brands like Wicked Sister to capture market share.

The Australian ice cream market is expected to grow at a slower pace, with a 1.51% CAGR, suggesting that innovation and unique marketing strategies will be key to driving growth in the frozen dessert segment.

ui.priorOpinion: The spring movie launch for Wicked Sister offers a chance to disrupt the frozen dessert market with a magical twist. This moment aligns perfectly with the upcoming Wicked: For Good film, capturing both the enchantment of cinema and the indulgence of desserts. As the market is set to grow at a 7.77% CAGR, seizing this opportunity can establish Wicked Sister as a category leader (Source: imarcgroup.com). Today, the plan works because it taps into the shopper‚Äôs desire for immediate gratification and shared experiences. The instant win mechanic aligns with the brand‚Äôs playful tone, while the film tie-in adds a layer of thematic magic. Retailers like Coles and Woolworths are primed for promotions that increase basket size without burdening staff (Source: coles.com.au). The cultural timing, with the film‚Äôs release, ensures heightened consumer interest and engagement. To improve, convert single movie tickets to double passes. This change enhances perceived value and emotional engagement, capitalizing on the film‚Äôs shared magic theme. Implement a daily winner cadence to maintain excitement and urgency, using digital channels to announce winners. This approach respects operational constraints and maximizes consumer touchpoints. The Strategist‚Äôs insight shows that a shared reward aligns with the cultural moment, increasing the promotion‚Äôs appeal. Retailers will appreciate the streamlined operations. No additional staff lift is reqred, as the digital-first approach ensures seamless integration. The buy-two mechanic promises increased basket size, defending freezer space against competitors like Streets and Sara Lee. The plan fits within current operational realities, ensuring retailer buy-in and support. To tighten, focus solely on the double pass upgrade. This pragmatic tweak maintains breadth while doubling emotional engagement, without altering store operations. For a stretch, introduce a hero overlay with grand prizes like a lury cinema experience. Fund this from the existing prize budget, adding aspiration without compromising the broad appeal. This bolder move enhances the fame overlay, aligning with the Wicked IP. ‚ÄúWin a Double Pass Instantly‚Äù ‚ÄúPurchase two, upload receipt, and win instantly.‚Äù

brandTruths.text: Wicked Sister is leveraging the excitement of the upcoming 'Wicked: For Good' film by launching a limited-edition dessert pot range, aiming to drive consumer engagement through a movie-themed promotion.

The brand's promotion offers an instant win mechanic, where purchasing two packs of Wicked Sister products gives consumers a chance to win movie tickets, effectively incentivizing multi-pack purchases.

shopperTensions.text: Consumers are increasingly seeking convenience and indulgence, yet face cost-of-living pressures that may limit discretionary spending on premium desserts.
While Wicked Sister positions itself as an everyday indulgence, the need to balance health-conscious choices with indulgence may create tension for health-aware consumers.

retailerReality.text: Coles and Woolworths dominate the retail landscape, with exclusive promotions like the Wicked Sister x Wicked campaign running through Woolworths, highlighting the retailer's clout in driving brand visibility.
Freezer congestion in major supermarkets can limit shelf space for new product launches, making strategic partnerships with retailers crucial for visibility.

competitorMoves.text: Rokeby Farms is expanding its product range with high-protein offerings, appealing to health-conscious consumers and potentially diverting attention from indulgent dessert options.
Competitors like Streets continue to maintain strong market presence, emphasizing the need for Wicked Sister to differentiate through unique promotions and partnerships.

categorySignals.text: The frozen desserts market is projected to grow significantly, with a CAGR of approximately 5.4% from 2024 to 2034, indicating a robust opportunity for brands like Wicked Sister to capture market share.

The Australian ice cream market is expected to grow at a slower pace, with a 1.51% CAGR, suggesting that innovation and unique marketing strategies will be key to driving growth in the frozen dessert segment.

debug.strategist_prompt:
Campaign: Wicked Sister ‚Äî Spring Movie Launch (Client: Wicked Sister)
Market: AU | Category: Frozen Desserts | Brand position: DISRUPTOR
BRIEF (facts):
Brand: Wicked Sister | Client: Wicked Sister | Hook: Win a Movie Ticket Instantly | Mechanic: Buy 2 products, upload receipts and discover instantly if you‚Äôve scored a movie ticket. | Promotion: INSTANT_WIN | Retailers: Coles, Woolworths, ALDI, IGA, 7-Eleven | Calendar: Spring | IP tie-in (licensed): Wicked ‚Äî For Good ‚Äî type: FILM ‚Äî window: November 2025 | Orientation: LIVE | RuleFlex: KEEP | Mode: FORWARD (future/in-flight) | Breadth/cadence winners present: ~2010.
PROMOTRACK (private guardrails & winning patterns):
PROMOTRACK GUARDRAILS (private; do not cite verbatim):
- Hassle: prefer one-screen mobile entry; use QR as a pointer only if natural. Avoid mandatory receipt upload unless clearly warranted.
- Perceived odds (non-assured value only): hero + visible ladder (instant wins and/or weekly moments) usually outperforms single mega-prize.
- Retailer ops: zero staff adjudication; ship pre-packed POS; centralise winner comms & fulfilment.
- Explain-in-5s: staff should pitch in one breath; avoid multi-step or technical terms.
- Compliance (AU default): RSA/ABAC lines for alcohol; age gate; no consumption cues.
- Fulfilment: travel prizes need buffers/concierge; publish timelines in T&Cs.
- KPIs: name ONE primary success metric; align mechanic and value to it.
Use these guardrails to reduce hassle, improve perceived value/odds where relevant, and de-risk store ops. Prefer simple one-screen flows, central adjudication, and clear staff scripts.

Contextual flags:
- Hassle flag: brief suggests receipt/proof handling. Keep it one-screen and simple; only require uploads if value clearly warrants and OCR is seamless.

RuleFlex: KEEP
Apply guardrails strictly; prefer the simplest compliant path; no novelty for novelty‚Äôs sake.

Reminder: recommendations must land store-safe (zero staff burden), keep the hook premium and short.

PRIOR FRAMING (authoritative; do not restate):
Where the Demand Is

Spring in Australia is a time of renewal and fresh starts. Consumers are drawn to lighter, indulgent treats as the weather warms up. The frozen dessert market is expanding, with a projected growth rate of 5.4% from 2024 to 2034 (Source: globalinsightservices.com). This growth is driven by a desire for convenient yet premium dessert options. As grocery shopping trends shift towards convenience and indulgence, Wicked Sister is well-positioned to capture attention with its movie-themed promotion.

Who It‚Äôs For & What Stops Them

The primary audience includes grocery buyers who enjoy treating their families to indulgent desserts. They plan movie nights and share their dessert finds on social media. However, cost-of-living pressures can limit their spending on premium items (Source: retail.org.au). Health-conscious consumers might also hesitate, balancing indulgence with health considerations. These buyers seek value and convenience, making instant win promotions appealing.

Competitor Map

Streets and Sara Lee are key competitors in the frozen dessert category. Streets maintains a strong presence with classic offerings, while Sara Lee focuses on indulgent, ready-to-serve desserts. Rokeby Farms, with its high-protein products, appeals to health-conscious consumers, potentially diverting attention from more indulgent options (Source: rokebynutrition.com). Wicked Sister's unique movie tie-in and instant win mechanic differentiate it by offering an experiential reward.

Brand Lens (truth, codes to lean/break)

Wicked Sister embodies everyday indulgence, aligning with family movie nights through its movie-themed promotions. The brand breaks away from complex entry mechanics and single mega-prizes, focusing instead on instant wins and family rewards. Wicked Sister‚Äôs playful and exciting tone of voice emphasizes the thrill of winning, while its distinctive assets include movie-themed packaging and indulgent dessert messaging.

The Idea As It Stands

The current promotion invites consumers to buy two packs of Wicked Sister products for a chance to instantly win a movie ticket. This mechanic encourages multi-pack purchases, driving sales and engagement ahead of the Wicked film release. The instant win format is straightforward, appealing to consumers seeking immediate gratification.

Proposition Candidates

1. Indulge in a Wicked Treat
2. Win Your Movie Night
3. Instant Movie Magic

Hooks (2‚Äì6 words)

Win a Movie Ticket Instantly  
Indulge and Win  
Movie Night Magic  

What We‚Äôd Lean On

The instant win mechanic is the promotion's backbone, providing immediate excitement and gratification. The tie-in with the Wicked film adds a layer of thematic engagement, appealing to families planning movie nights. The broad distribution across major retailers like Coles and Woolworths ensures visibility and accessibility.

Hypotheses for Evaluation

1. The instant win mechanic will drive higher purchase volume due to its immediate reward.
2. The movie tie-in will enhance brand engagement, particularly among families planning movie nights.
3. The promotion will increase brand visibility and shelf presence in major retailers.

Entry/Redemption (from brief): Buy 2 qualifying products, upload receipt

OFFER_IQ (authoritative): verdict=REVIEW; score=4.9; hard_flags=none.
PRIOR OPINION (authoritative; integrate lightly if still relevant):
The spring movie launch for Wicked Sister offers a chance to disrupt the frozen dessert market with a magical twist. This moment aligns perfectly with the upcoming Wicked: For Good film, capturing both the enchantment of cinema and the indulgence of desserts. As the market is set to grow at a 7.77% CAGR, seizing this opportunity can establish Wicked Sister as a category leader (Source: imarcgroup.com). Today, the plan works because it taps into the shopper‚Äôs desire for immediate gratification and shared experiences. The instant win mechanic aligns with the brand‚Äôs playful tone, while the film tie-in adds a layer of thematic magic. Retailers like Coles and Woolworths are primed for promotions that increase basket size without burdening staff (Source: coles.com.au). The cultural timing, with the film‚Äôs release, ensures heightened consumer interest and engagement. To improve, convert single movie tickets to double passes. This change enhances perceived value and emotional engagement, capitalizing on the film‚Äôs shared magic theme. Implement a daily winner cadence to maintain excitement and urgency, using digital channels to announce winners. This approach respects operational constraints and maximizes consumer touchpoints. The Strategist‚Äôs insight shows that a shared reward aligns with the cultural moment, increasing the promotion‚Äôs appeal. Retailers will appreciate the streamlined operations. No additional staff lift is reqred, as the digital-first approach ensures seamless integration. The buy-two mechanic promises increased basket size, defending freezer space against competitors like Streets and Sara Lee. The plan fits within current operational realities, ensuring retailer buy-in and support. To tighten, focus solely on the double pass upgrade. This pragmatic tweak maintains breadth while doubling emotional engagement, without altering store operations. For a stretch, introduce a hero overlay with grand prizes like a lury cinema experience. Fund this from the existing prize budget, adding aspiration without compromising the broad appeal. This bolder move enhances the fame overlay, aligning with the Wicked IP. ‚ÄúWin a Double Pass Instantly‚Äù ‚ÄúPurchase two, upload receipt, and win instantly.‚Äù

- Retailer reality: Coles and Woolworths dominate the retail landscape, with exclusive promotions like the Wicked Sister x Wicked campaign running through Woolworths, highlighting the retailer's clout in driving brand visibility. (coles.com.au)
- Retailer reality: Freezer congestion in major supermarkets can limit shelf space for new product launches, making strategic partnerships with retailers crucial for visibility. (woolworths.com.au)

You must return ONE JSON object ONLY. No preamble, no markdown, no commentary.

Context:
- Audience: Australian brand, shopper, and retail stakeholders.
- Tone: direct, premium, no clich√©s (‚Äúfriction‚Äù, ‚Äúprize ladder‚Äù). Use plain words like ‚Äúhassle‚Äù, ‚Äúchances‚Äù, ‚Äúmix of winners‚Äù, ‚Äúon pack‚Äù, ‚Äúin-store‚Äù, ‚ÄúPOS‚Äù.
- The composer will turn this JSON into flowing prose; keep fields tight and specific.

Required top-level fields (all optionality MUST be honoured, but include your best effort):

  },

    "stock_risk": "low"|"medium"|"high"|"unknown" | null,

  },
  "what_worked": string[],                    // short observations (1 line each)
  "what_didnt": string[],                     // short observations (1 line each)
  "risks": string[],                          // e.g. "people drop at proof upload"
  "fixes": string[],                          // practical changes in plain words

  // Narrative drivers for the composer (use tight, specific lines)
  "ferrier_bets": string[],                   // behavioural bets (cut hassle, habit, social proof, etc.)

  // PromoTrack

  // Judgement drives verdict tone in the composer
  "judgement": {

  },

  },

  // Optionally propose one or more bolder takes (rule-bending)

    {
      "name": string | null,                  // e.g. "Two-word fame line + instant-win wall"
      "idea": string | null,

      "risks": string[] | null,

      "measures": string[] | null,            // how we‚Äôll judge it (metrics/observables)
      "exit": string | null                   // when to pull the pin
    }
  ]
}

debug.opinion_prompt:
Campaign: Wicked Sister ‚Äî Spring Movie Launch (Client: Wicked Sister)
Market: AU | Category: Frozen Desserts | Mode: FORWARD
AssuredMode: NON_ASSURED
Verdict to uphold: NO-GO
Prize mode: BREADTH/CADENCE (no hero).
Facts:
Brand: Wicked Sister | Client: Wicked Sister | Hook: Win a Movie Ticket Instantly | Mechanic: Buy 2 products, upload receipts and discover instantly if you‚Äôve scored a movie ticket. | Promotion: INSTANT_WIN | Retailers: Coles, Woolworths, ALDI, IGA, 7-Eleven | Calendar: Spring | IP tie-in (licensed): Wicked ‚Äî For Good ‚Äî type: FILM ‚Äî window: November 2025 | Orientation: LIVE | RuleFlex: KEEP | Mode: FORWARD (future/in-flight) | Breadth/cadence winners present: ~2010.
Guidance: Entry friction already approved ‚Äî keep mechanics as briefed.
Guidance: Hero overlay encouraged ‚Äî tie fame to Wicked IP.
Operational guardrails: Store teams have zero capacity ‚Äî no staff-run announcements, kiosks, or manual verification. Prize pool is fixed at 2010 passes; if you explore double passes, make clear the winner count drops to ~1005 on the same spend. Keep cadence visible through consumer-facing messaging (pack, digital, social), not store labour. Never suggest staff-run amplification, kiosks, or in-store terminals ‚Äî execution must run on consumer comms and zero additional store labour.
Briefed entry mechanic: Buy 2 qualifying products, upload receipt. Keep the plan anchored in this flow.
Research hints:
Brand truth: Wicked Sister is leveraging the excitement of the upcoming 'Wicked: For Good' film by launching a limited-edition dessert pot range, aiming to drive consumer engagement through a movie-themed promotion. (insidefmcg.com.au) | Brand truth: The brand's promotion offers an instant win mechanic, where purchasing two packs of Wicked Sister products gives consumers a chance to win movie tickets, effectively incentivizing multi-pack purchases. (wickedsisterwin.com.au) | Shopper tension: Consumers are increasingly seeking convenience and indulgence, yet face cost-of-living pressures that may limit discretionary spending on premium desserts. (retail.org.au) | Shopper tension: While Wicked Sister positions itself as an everyday indulgence, the need to balance health-conscious choices with indulgence may create tension for health-aware consumers. (wickedsister.com.au) | Retailer reality: Coles and Woolworths dominate the retail landscape, with exclusive promotions like the Wicked Sister x Wicked campaign running through Woolworths, highlighting the retailer's clout in driving brand visibility. (coles.com.au) | Retailer reality: Freezer congestion in major supermarkets can limit shelf space for new product launches, making strategic partnerships with retailers crucial for visibility. (woolworths.com.au) Recommended hero-prize count: 3 (perceived odds; invest remainder into breadth/instants). Double-pass scenario would deliver ~1005 winners on the same 2010 tickets.
Framing (authoritative; do not restate, use to inform tone):
Where the Demand Is

Spring in Australia is a time of renewal and fresh starts. Consumers are drawn to lighter, indulgent treats as the weather warms up. The frozen dessert market is expanding, with a projected growth rate of 5.4% from 2024 to 2034 (Source: globalinsightservices.com). This growth is driven by a desire for convenient yet premium dessert options. As grocery shopping trends shift towards convenience and indulgence, Wicked Sister is well-positioned to capture attention with its movie-themed promotion.

Who It‚Äôs For & What Stops Them

The primary audience includes grocery buyers who enjoy treating their families to indulgent desserts. They plan movie nights and share their dessert finds on social media. However, cost-of-living pressures can limit their spending on premium items (Source: retail.org.au). Health-conscious consumers might also hesitate, balancing indulgence with health considerations. These buyers seek value and convenience, making instant win promotions appealing.

Competitor Map

Streets and Sara Lee are key competitors in the frozen dessert category. Streets maintains a strong presence with classic offerings, while Sara Lee focuses on indulgent, ready-to-serve desserts. Rokeby Farms, with its high-protein products, appeals to health-conscious consumers, potentially diverting attention from more indulgent options (Source: rokebynutrition.com). Wicked Sister's unique movie tie-in and instant win mechanic differentiate it by offering an experiential reward.

Brand Lens (truth, codes to lean/break)

Wicked Sister embodies everyday indulgence, aligning with family movie nights through its movie-themed promotions. The brand breaks away from complex entry mechanics and single mega-prizes, focusing instead on instant wins and family rewards. Wicked Sister‚Äôs playful and exciting tone of voice emphasizes the thrill of winning, while its distinctive assets include movie-themed packaging and indulgent dessert messaging.

The Idea As It Stands

The current promotion invites consumers to buy two packs of Wicked Sister products for a chance to instantly win a movie ticket. This mechanic encourages multi-pack purchases, driving sales and engagement ahead of the Wicked film release. The instant win format is straightforward, appealing to consumers seeking immediate gratification.

Proposition Candidates

1. Indulge in a Wicked Treat
2. Win Your Movie Night
3. Instant Movie Magic

Hooks (2‚Äì6 words)

Win a Movie Ticket Instantly  
Indulge and Win  
Movie Night Magic  

What We‚Äôd Lean On

The instant win mechanic is the promotion's backbone, providing immediate excitement and gratification. The tie-in with the Wicked film adds a layer of thematic engagement, appealing to families planning movie nights. The broad distribution across major retailers like Coles and Woolworths ensures visibility and accessibility.

Hypotheses for Evaluation

1. The instant win mechanic will drive higher purchase volume due to its immediate reward.
2. The movie tie-in will enhance brand engagement, particularly among families planning movie nights.
3. The promotion will increase brand visibility and shelf presence in major retailers.

Entry/Redemption (from brief): Buy 2 qualifying products, upload receipt

OFFER_IQ (authoritative): verdict=REVIEW; score=4.9; hard_flags=none.

- double the movie magic
- movie night for two ‚Äî 1,000 double passes.
- two desserts. two seats. every hour.
- dessert doubles your tickets.
- upload & share the cinema night.
Write a concise evaluation using this exact template. Keep each section to two sentences or fewer unless noted.
Verdict ‚Äî one sentence that names the judgement and the cultural/commercial why.
Why it works ‚Äî max two sentences tying brand truth, shopper tension, and timing.
Where it breaks ‚Äî max two sentences naming the hardest flaws.
Fix it ‚Äî max two sentences with the concrete plan to repair those flaws.
Retailer reality ‚Äî max two sentences showing the buyer why this earns easy range with zero staff lift.
If you recommend turning single tickets into double passes, state plainly that the winner count halves while perceived value doubles; never imply winner count stays flat.

Hook shortlist ‚Äî list exactly five lines starting with "- " that evolve the candidates above. Each hook must reinforce the shared double-pass promise or instant win clarity; avoid inventing unrelated slogans.
Measurement ‚Äî one sentence naming the single metric watched first.
Pack line ‚Äî provide a 2‚Äì6 word line in quotes.
Staff line ‚Äî provide a ‚â§5 second staff script in quotes.
Rules: no other headings, no extra bullets, no filler. Cite sources inline (‚ÄúSource: ‚Ä¶‚Äù) whenever you quote data.

extrasAll.title: hooks
extrasAll.content:
1. **Taste the Magic, Win the Night!** ‚Äî This line directly connects the indulgence of dessert with the thrill of a movie experience, creating excitement around both elements.

2. **Dessert Dreams Meet Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Evokes a sense of fantasy while emphasizing the chance to win, appealing to consumers‚Äô desires for both treats and experiences.

3. **Unlock a Night at the Movies!** ‚Äî Leverages the idea of discovery and opportunity, inviting consumers to participate in a rewarding experience.

4. **Indulge and Instantly Win Wicked Surprises!** ‚Äî The use of 'instantly' enhances the promotional urgency while aligning with the indulgent nature of the product.

5. **Sweet Treats, Sweet Wins: Join the Wicked Fun!** ‚Äî This tagline positions the promotion as part of a collective experience, encouraging shared participation.

6. **Win the Ultimate Movie Night Experience!** ‚Äî Highlights a desirable outcome that resonates with family-oriented consumers looking to enhance their home entertainment.

7. **Dive into Delicious Desserts and Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Conveys the excitement of indulgence while emphasizing the potential for winning, creating a sense of adventure.

8. **Scoop Up Sweet Rewards with Wicked Sisters!** ‚Äî Invokes a playful tone while reinforcing the brand identity, cementing the connection between dessert and winning.

9. **Your Ticket to a Magical Movie Night Awaits!** ‚Äî Suggests that participation is not just about dessert, but about creating memorable experiences, enhancing perceived value.

10. **Grab a Spoon, Grab a Chance at Wicked Prizes!** ‚Äî Combines the act of indulging in desserts with the excitement of winning, making it effortless and engaging.

11. **Indulgence Meets Instant Gratification: Join the Wicked Experience!** ‚Äî This tagline captures the essence of the campaign, appealing to modern consumers' craving for both luxury and immediacy.

12. **Feel the Magic ‚Äî Win Big with Wicked Sisters!** ‚Äî Ties the emotional resonance of the film experience to the promotion, creating an engaging narrative for consumers.

13. **Delight in Every Scoop, Win Every Time!** ‚Äî Reinforces the idea of enjoyment with the added incentive of winning, promoting an ongoing relationship with the product.

14. **Join the Dessert Revolution: Win Wickedly Instant Prizes!** ‚Äî Positions the promotion as trendy and exciting, appealing to consumers looking for new experiences.

15. **Experience the Enchantment: Win Wicked Movie Magic!** ‚Äî Playfully connects the campaign to the film's themes, creating a sense of anticipation and excitement.

16. **Unwrap the Magic of Wicked Prizes with Every Bite!** ‚Äî Suggests that each dessert brings the possibility of winning, reinforcing the idea of enchantment.

17. **Your Dessert Just Became a Treasure Hunt for Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Adds an element of adventure and surprise to the act of indulging in desserts, enticing engagement.

18. **Taste the Adventure, Win the Night with Wicked Sisters!** ‚Äî Enhances the campaign's call to action by framing it in terms of exploration and excitement.

19. **Sweeten Your Movie Nights with Instant Wicked Wins!** ‚Äî Directly appeals to family-centered moments, making desserts a part of treasured experiences.

20. **Dare to Dream: Indulge in Desserts and Win Wickedly!** ‚Äî Encourages consumers to embrace their desires while promising tangible rewards, fostering a sense of aspiration.
